ai-mil3.2.3:1.9_0: “Great king, in the places of the kings or the professions of the gradual preceding east, west, north, or so on.”
ai-mil3.2.3:1.11_0: “And what is known as suffering does not lead to what is impermanent, suffering, and perishable, would you have done for them?”
ai-mil3.2.3:1.13_0: “Great king, when you have arisen, you cease right there.”
ai-mil3.2.3:2.2_0: “Now, great king, someone would fall in the darkness and light a lamp into the darkness of night.
ai-mil3.2.3:2.3_0: In the same way, when delusion has arisen, cease as a brahmin.”
ai-mil3.2.3:3.1_0: “But sir, how do you get by wisdom?”

ai-mil3.2.3:4.3_0: In the same way, when their own wisdom ceases, all that ignoble and pointlessly ceases, or else ‘they are suffering’ or ‘non-percipient’ or ‘neither’.”

ai-mil3.2.3:6.2_0: “As a time, great king, a Vessavaṇa should take the five tonics and roots and medicines and supplies for the sick, and then I’ll make them sure that you’re able to get all these five things.”
ai-mil3.2.3:6.3_0: “But sir, what is the root of all with youths rooted in those five roots? ”
ai-mil3.2.3:6.4_0: “Here, great king, the five faculties of faith, the five faculties, the five faculties, the faculty of faith, energy, and wisdom. That is how the faculty of faith is seen, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
